meanings.definition: Of or relating to a metronome.
meanings.sent1: The metronomical ticking of the metronome helped the musician stay on beat.
meanings.sent2: The metronomical device kept time for the pianist during her performance.
meanings.sent3: The metronomical metronome decided to take a break and dance to its own rhythm.
meanings.sent4: Her heart beat in a metronomical rhythm, like a clock ticking inside her chest.
meanings.sent5: The metronomical sound of the metronome echoed through the music room, guiding the players.

meanings.definition: Having a steady and precise rhythm or tempo.
meanings.sent1: The metronomical drumming of the rain on the roof was soothing.
meanings.sent2: The metronomical movement of the pendulum was mesmerizing to watch.
meanings.sent3: The metronomical cat walked with perfect timing, as if following a beat.
meanings.sent4: His metronomical footsteps echoed in the empty hallway, creating a sense of order.
meanings.sent5: The metronomical swaying of the trees in the wind was a calming sight.
